description: Base class for all services.

contents.name: instance_name
contents.description:
A friendly name that describes the role of this service instance in the device.
It often corresponds to what's printed on the device:
for example, `A` for button A, or `S0` for servo channel 0.
Words like `left` should be avoided because of localization issues (unless they are printed on the device).

contents.name: status_code
contents.description:
Reports the current state or error status of the device. ``code`` is a standardized value from 
the Jacdac status/error codes. ``vendor_code`` is any vendor specific error code describing the device
state. This report is typically not queried, when a device has an error, it will typically
add this report in frame along with the announce packet. If a service implements this register,
it should also support the ``status_code_changed`` event defined below.

contents.name: status_code_changed
contents.description: Notifies that the status code of the service changed.

description: Base class for sensors.

contents.name: streaming_interval
contents.description: Period between packets of data when streaming in milliseconds.

description: A 3-axis accelerometer.

contents.name: forces
contents.description: Indicates the current forces acting on accelerometer.

contents.name: forces_error
contents.description: Error on the reading value.

contents.name: max_force
contents.description:
Configures the range forces detected.
Read-back after setting to get current value.

contents.name: tilt_up
contents.description: Emitted when accelerometer is tilted in the given direction.

contents.name: tilt_down
contents.description: Emitted when accelerometer is tilted in the given direction.

contents.name: tilt_left
contents.description: Emitted when accelerometer is tilted in the given direction.

contents.name: tilt_right
contents.description: Emitted when accelerometer is tilted in the given direction.

contents.name: face_up
contents.description: Emitted when accelerometer is laying flat in the given direction.

contents.name: face_down
contents.description: Emitted when accelerometer is laying flat in the given direction.

contents.name: freefall
contents.description: Emitted when total force acting on accelerometer is much less than 1g.

contents.name: shake
contents.description: Emitted when forces change violently a few times.

contents.name: force_2g
contents.description: Emitted when force in any direction exceeds given threshold.

contents.name: force_3g
contents.description: Emitted when force in any direction exceeds given threshold.

contents.name: force_6g
contents.description: Emitted when force in any direction exceeds given threshold.

contents.name: force_8g
contents.description: Emitted when force in any direction exceeds given threshold.

description: A capacitive or pressure sensitive push-button.

contents.name: pressure
contents.description: Indicates the current pressure (``force``) on the button.

contents.name: inactive_threshold
contents.description: Indicates the lower threshold for ``inactive`` events.

contents.name: active_threshold
contents.description: Indicates the threshold for ``active`` events.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical button.

contents.name: active
contents.description: Emitted when button goes from inactive (pressure less than threshold) to active.

contents.name: inactive
contents.description: Emitted when button goes from active (pressure higher than threshold) to inactive.

description:
A gamepad with direction and action buttons for one player.
If a device has multiple controllers, it should have multiple gamepad services, using consecutive service identifiers.

contents.name: down
contents.description: Emitted when button goes from inactive to active.

contents.name: up
contents.description: Emitted when button goes from active to inactive.

description:
A sound playing device.

This is typically run over an SPI connection, not regular single-wire JACDAC.

contents.name: sample_rate
contents.description:
Get or set playback sample rate (in samples per second).
If you set it, read it back, as the value may be rounded up or down.

contents.name: buffer_size
contents.description: The size of the internal audio buffer.

contents.name: buffer_pending
contents.description:
How much data is still left in the buffer to play.
Clients should not send more data than `buffer_size - buffer_pending`,
but can keep the `buffer_pending` as low as they want to ensure low latency
of audio playback.

description: A device that reads various barcodes, like QR codes. For the web, see [BarcodeDetector](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BarcodeDetector).

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turns on or off the detection of barcodes.

contents.name: detect
contents.description:
Raised when a bar code is detected and decoded. If the reader detects multiple codes, it will issue multiple events.
In case of numeric barcodes, the `data` field should contain the ASCII (which is the same as UTF8 in that case) representation of the number.

description: A sensor measuring air pressure of outside environment.

contents.name: pressure
contents.description: The air pressure.

contents.name: pressure_error
contents.description: The real pressure is between `pressure - pressure_error` and `pressure + pressure_error`.

description: Support for sending and receiving packets using the [Bit Radio protocol](https://github.com/microsoft/pxt-common-packages/blob/master/libs/radio/docs/reference/radio.md), typically used between micro:bit devices.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turns on/off the radio antenna.

contents.name: group
contents.description: Group used to filter packets

contents.name: transmission_power
contents.description: Antenna power to increase or decrease range.

contents.name: frequency_band
contents.description: Change the transmission and reception band of the radio to the given channel.

contents.name: string_received
contents.description: Raised when a string packet is received

contents.name: number_received
contents.description: Raised when a number packet is received

contents.name: buffer_received
contents.description: Raised when a buffer packet is received

description: Allows flashing (reprogramming) devices over Jacdac.
A push-button, which returns to inactive position when not operated anymore.

contents.name: pressed
contents.description: Indicates whether the button is currently active (pressed).

contents.name: down
contents.description: Emitted when button goes from inactive (`pressed == 0`) to active.

contents.name: up
contents.description: Emitted when button goes from active (`pressed == 1`) to inactive.

contents.name: click
contents.description: Emitted together with `up` when the press time was not longer than 500ms.

contents.name: long_click
contents.description: Emitted after button is held for 500ms. Long click events are followed by a separate up event.

contents.name: hold
contents.description: Emitted after the button is held for 1500ms. Hold events are followed by a separate up event.

description: A simple buzzer.

contents.name: volume
contents.description: The volume (duty cycle) of the buzzer.

description: A screen that displays characters.

contents.name: message
contents.description: Text to show. Use `\n` to break lines.

contents.name: brightness
contents.description: Brightness of the screen. `0` means off.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Describes the type of character LED screen.

contents.name: text_direction
contents.description: Specifies the RTL or LTR direction of the text.

contents.name: rows
contents.description: Gets the number of rows.

contents.name: columns
contents.description: Gets the number of columns.

description: Senses RGB colors

contents.name: color
contents.description: Detected color in the RGB color space.

description: A sensor that measures the heading.

contents.name: heading
contents.description: The heading with respect to the magnetic north.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turn on or off the sensor. Turning on the sensor may start a calibration sequence.

contents.name: heading_error
contents.description: Error on the heading reading

description:
Control service is always service index `0`.
It handles actions common to all services on a device.

contents.name: reset_in
contents.description:
When set to value other than `0`, it asks the device to reset after specified number of microseconds.
This is typically used to implement watchdog functionality, where a brain device sets `reset_in` to
say 1.6s every 0.5s.

contents.name: device_description
contents.description: Identifies the type of hardware (eg., ACME Corp. Servo X-42 Rev C)

contents.name: firmware_identifier
contents.description: A numeric code for the string above; used to identify firmware images and devices.

contents.name: bootloader_firmware_identifier
contents.description: Typically the same as `firmware_identifier` unless device was flashed by hand; the bootloader will respond to that code.

contents.name: firmware_version
contents.description: A string describing firmware version; typically semver.

contents.name: mcu_temperature
contents.description: MCU temperature in degrees Celsius (approximate).

contents.name: uptime
contents.description: Number of microseconds since boot.

contents.name: device_url
contents.description: Request the information web site for this device

contents.name: firmware_url
contents.description: URL with machine-readable metadata information about updating device firmware

description: A sensor that determines the distance of an object without any physical contact involved.

contents.name: distance
contents.description: Current distance from the object

contents.name: min_range
contents.description: Minimum measurable distance

contents.name: max_range
contents.description: Maximum measurable distance

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Determines the type of sensor used.

description: A service that can send DMX512-A packets with limited size. This service is designed to allow tinkering with a few DMX devices, but only allows 235 channels. More about DMX at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DMX512.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Determines if the DMX bridge is active

description: Measures equivalent CO₂ levels.

contents.name: e_CO2
contents.description: Equivalent CO₂ (eCO₂) readings.

contents.name: e_CO2_error
contents.description: Error on the reading value.

contents.name: min_e_CO2
contents.description: Minimum measurable value

contents.name: max_e_CO2
contents.description: Minimum measurable value

contents.name: conditioning_period
contents.description: Time required to achieve good sensor stability before measuring after long idle period.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Type of physical sensor and capabilities.

description: A 3-axis gyroscope.

contents.name: rotation_rates
contents.description: Indicates the current forces acting on accelerometer.

contents.name: rotation_rates_error
contents.description: Error on the reading value.

contents.name: max_rate
contents.description: Configures the range of range of rotation rates.

description:
A sensor approximating the heart rate. 


**Jacdac is NOT suitable for medical devices and should NOT be used in any kind of device to diagnose or treat any medical conditions.**

contents.name: heart_rate
contents.description: The estimated heart rate.

contents.name: heart_rate_error
contents.description: The estimated error on the reported sensor data.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical sensor

description:
Control a HID keyboard. 

This service cannot be simulated.

The codes for the key (selectors) is defined in the [HID Keyboard
specification](https://usb.org/sites/default/files/hut1_21.pdf), chapter 10 Keyboard/Keypad Page, page 81.

The device keeps tracks of the key state and is able to clear it all with the clear command.

Controls a HID mouse. 

This service cannot be simulated.
A sensor measuring humidity of outside environment.

contents.name: humidity
contents.description: The relative humidity in percentage of full water saturation.

contents.name: humidity_error
contents.description: The real humidity is between `humidity - humidity_error` and `humidity + humidity_error`.

contents.name: min_humidity
contents.description: Lowest humidity that can be reported.

contents.name: max_humidity
contents.description: Highest humidity that can be reported.

description:
Detects the amount of light falling onto a given surface area.

Note that this is different from *luminance*, the amount of light that passes through, emits from, or reflects off an object.

contents.name: light
contents.description: The amount of illuminance, as lumens per square metre.

contents.name: light_error
contents.description: Error on the reported sensor value.

description:
A screen with indexed colors.

This is often run over an SPI connection, not regular single-wire JACDAC.

contents.name: brightness
contents.description:
Set backlight brightness.
If set to `0` the display may go to sleep.

contents.name: bits_per_pixel
contents.description:
Determines the number of palette entries.
Typical values are 1, 2, 4, or 8.

contents.name: width
contents.description: Screen width in "natural" orientation.

contents.name: height
contents.description: Screen height in "natural" orientation.

contents.name: width_major
contents.description:
If true, consecutive pixels in the "width" direction are sent next to each other (this is typical for graphics cards).
If false, consecutive pixels in the "height" direction are sent next to each other.
For embedded screen controllers, this is typically true iff `width < height`
(in other words, it's only true for portrait orientation screens).
Some controllers may allow the user to change this (though the refresh order may not be optimal then).
This is independent of the `rotation` register.

contents.name: up_sampling
contents.description:
Every pixel sent over wire is represented by `up_sampling x up_sampling` square of physical pixels.
Some displays may allow changing this (which will also result in changes to `width` and `height`).
Typical values are 1 and 2.

contents.name: rotation
contents.description:
Possible values are 0, 90, 180 and 270 only.
Write to this register do not affect `width` and `height` registers,
and may be ignored by some screens.

description: Send messages, receive commands, and work with device twins in Azure IoT Hub.

contents.name: connection_status
contents.description: Returns `"ok"` when connected, and an error description otherwise.

contents.name: connection_string
contents.description:
Connection string typically looks something like 
`HostName=my-iot-hub.azure-devices.net;DeviceId=my-dev-007;SharedAccessKey=xyz+base64key`.
You can get it in `Shared access policies -> iothubowner -> Connection string-primary key` in the Azure Portal.
This register is write-only.
You can use `hub_name` and `device_id` to check if connection string is set, but you cannot get the shared access key.

contents.name: hub_name
contents.description: Something like `my-iot-hub.azure-devices.net`; empty string when `connection_string` is not set.

contents.name: device_id
contents.description: Something like `my-dev-007`; empty string when `connection_string` is not set.

contents.name: connected
contents.description: Emitted upon successful connection.

contents.name: connection_error
contents.description: Emitted when connection was lost.

contents.name: devicebound_str
contents.description:
This event is emitted upon reception of a cloud to device message, that is a string
(doesn't contain NUL bytes) and fits in a single event packet.
For reliable reception, use the `subscribe` command above.

description: A two axis directional joystick

contents.name: direction
contents.description:
The direction of the joystick measure in two direction.
If joystick is digital, then each direction will read as either `-0x8000`, `0x0`, or `0x7fff`.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical joystick.

contents.name: digital
contents.description: Indicates if the joystick is digital, typically made of switches.

description: A controller for 1 or more monochrome or RGB LEDs connected in parallel.

contents.name: brightness
contents.description:
Set the luminosity of the strip. The value is used to scale `value` in `steps` register.
At `0` the power to the strip is completely shut down.

contents.name: max_power
contents.description: Limit the power drawn by the light-strip (and controller).

contents.name: led_count
contents.description: If known, specifies the number of LEDs in parallel on this device.

contents.name: wave_length
contents.description: If monochrome LED, specifies the wave length of the LED.

contents.name: luminous_intensity
contents.description: The luminous intensity of the LED, at full value, in micro candella.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The physical type of LED.

description: A rectangular monochrome LED matrix controller.

contents.name: brightness
contents.description: Reads the general brightness of the LEDs. ``0`` when the screen is off.

contents.name: rows
contents.description: Number of rows on the screen

contents.name: columns
contents.description: Number of columns on the screen

description: A controller for strips of individually controlled RGB LEDs.

contents.name: brightness
contents.description:
Set the luminosity of the strip.
At `0` the power to the strip is completely shut down.

contents.name: actual_brightness
contents.description:
This is the luminosity actually applied to the strip.
May be lower than `brightness` if power-limited by the `max_power` register.
It will rise slowly (few seconds) back to `brightness` is limits are no longer required.

contents.name: light_type
contents.description:
Specifies the type of light strip connected to controller.
Controllers which are sold with lights should default to the correct type
and could not allow change.

contents.name: num_pixels
contents.description:
Specifies the number of pixels in the strip.
Controllers which are sold with lights should default to the correct length
and could not allow change. Increasing length at runtime leads to ineffective use of memory and may lead to controller reboot.

contents.name: num_columns
contents.description:
If the LED pixel strip is a matrix, specifies the number of columns. Otherwise, a square shape is assumed. Controllers which are sold with lights should default to the correct length
and could not allow change. Increasing length at runtime leads to ineffective use of memory and may lead to controller reboot.

contents.name: max_power
contents.description: Limit the power drawn by the light-strip (and controller).

contents.name: max_pixels
contents.description:
The maximum supported number of pixels.
All writes to `num_pixels` are clamped to `max_pixels`.

contents.name: num_repeats
contents.description:
How many times to repeat the program passed in `run` command.
Should be set before the `run` command.
Setting to `0` means to repeat forever.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Specifies the shape of the light strip.

description: A sensor that measures luminosity level.

contents.name: light_level
contents.description: Detect light level

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical sensor.

description: A service which can report messages to the bus.

contents.name: min_priority
contents.description:
Messages with level lower than this won't be emitted. The default setting may vary.
Loggers should revert this to their default setting if the register has not been
updated in 3000ms, and also keep the lowest setting they have seen in the last 1500ms.
Thus, clients should write this register every 1000ms and ignore messages which are
too verbose for them.

description: A 3-axis magnetometer.

contents.name: forces
contents.description:
Indicates the current magnetic field on magnetometer.
For reference: `1 mgauss` is `100 nT` (and `1 gauss` is `100 000 nT`).

contents.name: forces_error
contents.description: Error on the readings.

description: A matrix of buttons connected as a keypad

contents.name: rows
contents.description: Number of rows in the matrix

contents.name: columns
contents.description: Number of columns in the matrix

contents.name: variant
contents.description:
The type of physical keypad. If the variant is ``ElastomerLEDPixel``
and the next service on the device is a ``LEDPixel`` service, it is considered
as the service controlling the LED pixel on the keypad.

contents.name: down
contents.description: Emitted when a key, at the given index, goes from inactive (`pressed == 0`) to active.

contents.name: up
contents.description: Emitted when a key, at the given index, goes from active (`pressed == 1`) to inactive.

contents.name: click
contents.description: Emitted together with `up` when the press time was not longer than 500ms.

contents.name: long_click
contents.description: Emitted together with `up` when the press time was more than 500ms.

description: A single-channel microphone.

contents.name: sampling_period
contents.description:
Get or set microphone sampling period.
Sampling rate is `1_000_000 / sampling_period Hz`.

description: A MIDI output device.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Opens or closes the port to the MIDI device

description:
Runs machine learning models.

Only models with a single input tensor and a single output tensor are supported at the moment.
Input is provided by Sensor Aggregator service on the same device.
Multiple instances of this service may be present, if more than one model format is supported by a device.

contents.name: auto_invoke_every
contents.description:
When register contains `N > 0`, run the model automatically every time new `N` samples are collected.
Model may be run less often if it takes longer to run than `N * sampling_interval`.
The `outputs` register will stream its value after each run.
This register is not stored in flash.

contents.name: last_run_time
contents.description: The time consumed in last model execution.

contents.name: allocated_arena_size
contents.description: Number of RAM bytes allocated for model execution.

contents.name: model_size
contents.description: The size of the model in bytes.

contents.name: last_error
contents.description: Textual description of last error when running or loading model (if any).

contents.name: format
contents.description:
The type of ML models supported by this service.
`TFLite` is flatbuffer `.tflite` file.
`ML4F` is compiled machine code model for Cortex-M4F.
The format is typically present as first or second little endian word of model file.

contents.name: format_version
contents.description: A version number for the format.

contents.name: parallel
contents.description:
If present and true this service can run models independently of other
instances of this service on the device.

description: A sensor, typically PIR, that detects object motion within a certain range

contents.name: moving
contents.description: Reports is movement is currently detected by the sensor.

contents.name: max_distance
contents.description: Maximum distance where objects can be detected.

contents.name: angle
contents.description: Opening of the field of view

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Type of physical sensor

description: A bi-directional DC motor.

contents.name: duty
contents.description:
PWM duty cycle of the motor. Use negative/positive values to run the motor forwards and backwards.
Positive is recommended to be clockwise rotation and negative counterclockwise. A duty of ``0`` 
while ``enabled`` acts as brake.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turn the power to the motor on/off.

contents.name: load_torque
contents.description: Torque required to produce the rated power of an electrical motor at load speed.

contents.name: load_speed
contents.description: Revolutions per minute of the motor under full load.

description: A capacitive touch sensor with multiple inputs.

contents.name: touch
contents.description: Emitted when an input is touched.

contents.name: release
contents.description: Emitted when an input is no longer touched.

contents.name: tap
contents.description: Emitted when an input is briefly touched. TODO Not implemented.

contents.name: long_press
contents.description: Emitted when an input is touched for longer than 500ms. TODO Not implemented.

contents.name: swipe_pos
contents.description: Emitted when input channels are successively touched in order of increasing channel numbers.

contents.name: swipe_neg
contents.description: Emitted when input channels are successively touched in order of decreasing channel numbers.

description: A slider or rotary potentiometer.

contents.name: position
contents.description: The relative position of the slider between `0` and `1`.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Specifies the physical layout of the potentiometer.

description: A power-provider service.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turn the power to the bus on/off.

contents.name: max_power
contents.description:
Limit the power provided by the service. The actual maximum limit will depend on hardware.
This field may be read-only in some implementations - you should read it back after setting.

contents.name: overload
contents.description: Indicates whether the power has been shut down due to overdraw.

contents.name: current_draw
contents.description: Present current draw from the bus.

contents.name: battery_voltage
contents.description: Voltage on input.

contents.name: battery_charge
contents.description: Fraction of charge in the battery.

contents.name: battery_capacity
contents.description:
Energy that can be delivered to the bus when battery is fully charged.
This excludes conversion overheads if any.

contents.name: keep_on_pulse_duration
contents.description:
Many USB power packs need current to be drawn from time to time to prevent shutdown.
This regulates how often and for how long such current is drawn.
Typically a 1/8W 22 ohm resistor is used as load. This limits the duty cycle to 10%.

contents.name: keep_on_pulse_period
contents.description:
Many USB power packs need current to be drawn from time to time to prevent shutdown.
This regulates how often and for how long such current is drawn.
Typically a 1/8W 22 ohm resistor is used as load. This limits the duty cycle to 10%.

contents.name: priority_offset
contents.description:
This value is added to `priority` of `active` reports, thus modifying amount of load-sharing
between different supplies.
The `priority` is clamped to `u32` range when included in `active` reports.

description:
This is test service to validate the protocol packet transmissions between the browser and a MCU.
Use this page if you are porting Jacdac to a new platform.

contents.name: rw_bool
contents.description: A read write bool register.

contents.name: ro_bool
contents.description: A read only bool register. Mirrors rw_bool.

contents.name: rw_u32
contents.description: A read write u32 register.

contents.name: ro_u32
contents.description: A read only u32 register.. Mirrors rw_u32.

contents.name: rw_i32
contents.description: A read write i32 register.

contents.name: ro_i32
contents.description: A read only i32 register.. Mirrors rw_i32.

contents.name: rw_string
contents.description: A read write string register.

contents.name: ro_string
contents.description: A read only string register. Mirrors rw_string.

contents.name: rw_i8_u8_u16_i32
contents.description: A read write i8, u8, u16, i32 register.

contents.name: ro_i8_u8_u16_i32
contents.description: A read only i8, u8, u16, i32 register.. Mirrors rw_i8_u8_u16_i32.

contents.name: rw_u8_string
contents.description: A read write u8, string register.

contents.name: ro_u8_string
contents.description: A read only u8, string register.. Mirrors rw_u8_string.

contents.name: e_bool
contents.description: An event raised when rw_bool is modified

contents.name: e_u32
contents.description: An event raised when rw_u32 is modified

contents.name: e_i32
contents.description: An event raised when rw_i32 is modified

contents.name: e_string
contents.description: An event raised when rw_string is modified

contents.name: e_bytes
contents.description: An event raised when rw_bytes is modified

contents.name: e_i8_u8_u16_i32
contents.description: An event raised when rw_i8_u8_u16_i32 is modified

contents.name: e_u8_string
contents.description: An event raised when rw_u8_string is modified

description:
A sensor approximating the oxygen level. 

**Jacdac is not suitable for medical devices and should NOT be used in any kind of device to diagnose or treat any medical conditions.**

contents.name: oxygen
contents.description: The estimated oxygen level in blood.

contents.name: oxygen_error
contents.description: The estimated error on the reported sensor data.

description: Measures the amount of liquid precipitation over an area in a predefined period of time.

contents.name: precipitation
contents.description: Total precipitation recorded so far.

contents.name: precipitation_precision
contents.description: Typically the amount of rain needed for tipping the bucket.

description: Real time clock to support collecting data with precise time stamps.

contents.name: local_time
contents.description:
Current time in 24h representation. 
* ``day_of_month`` is day of the month, starting at ``1``
* ``day_of_week`` is day of the week, starting at ``1`` as monday
Default streaming period is 1 second.

contents.name: error
contents.description: Time drift since the last call to the ``set_time`` command.

contents.name: precision
contents.description: Error on the clock, in parts per million of seconds.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical clock used by the sensor.

description: A sensor that detects light and dark surfaces, commonly used for line following robots.

contents.name: brightness
contents.description: Reports the reflected brightness. It may be a digital value or, for some sensor, analog value.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Type of physical sensor used

contents.name: dark
contents.description: The sensor detected a transition from light to dark

contents.name: light
contents.description: The sensor detected a transition from dark to light

description: A switching relay.

contents.name: closed
contents.description: Indicates whether the relay circuit is currently on (closed) or off (closed).

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Describes the type of relay used.

contents.name: max_switching_current
contents.description: Maximum switching current for a resistive load.

contents.name: on
contents.description: Emitted when relay goes from ``off`` to ``on`` state.

contents.name: off
contents.description: Emitted when relay goes from ``on`` to ``off`` state.

description:
Generates random numbers using entropy sourced from physical processes.

This typically uses a cryptographical pseudo-random number generator (for example [Fortuna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortuna_(PRNG))),
which is periodically re-seeded with entropy coming from some hardware source.

contents.name: variant
contents.description:
The type of algorithm/technique used to generate the number.
`Quantum` refers to dedicated hardware device generating random noise due to quantum effects.
`ADCNoise` is the noise from quick readings of analog-digital converter, which reads temperature of the MCU or some floating pin.
`WebCrypto` refers is used in simulators, where the source of randomness comes from an advanced operating system.

description:
Assign roles to services on the Jacdac bus.

Internally, the role manager stores a mapping from from `(device_id, service_idx)` to role name.
Users refer to services by using role names (eg., they instantiate an accelerometer client with a given role name).
Each client has a role, and roles are unique to clients
(ie., one should not have both a gyro and accelerometer service with role `left_leg`).

Role names can be hierarchical, using slash character as a separator.
Examples: `left_leg/acc`, `left_leg/gyro`, `right_leg/acc`.
If two roles share the prefix before first slash, it should be used as a hint that the services
should be co-located on a single device
(eg., here the `left_leg` "location" is expected to have both an accelerometer and a gyro service on a single device).

contents.name: auto_bind
contents.description:
Normally, if some roles are unfilled, and there are idle services that can fulfill them,
the brain device will assign roles (bind) automatically.
Such automatic assignment happens every second or so, and is trying to be smart about 
co-locating roles that share "host" (part before first slash),
as well as reasonably stable assignments.
Once user start assigning roles manually using this service, auto-binding should be disabled to avoid confusion.

contents.name: all_roles_allocated
contents.description: Indicates if all required roles have been allocated to devices.

contents.name: change
contents.description: Emit notifying that the internal state of the service changed.

description: An incremental rotary encoder - converts angular motion of a shaft to digital signal.

contents.name: position
contents.description:
Upon device reset starts at `0` (regardless of the shaft position).
Increases by `1` for a clockwise "click", by `-1` for counter-clockwise.

contents.name: clicks_per_turn
contents.description: This specifies by how much `position` changes when the crank does 360 degree turn. Typically 12 or 24.

description:
Aggregate data from multiple sensors into a single stream
(often used as input to machine learning models on the same device, see model runner service).

contents.name: num_samples
contents.description: Number of input samples collected so far.

contents.name: sample_size
contents.description: Size of a single sample.

contents.name: streaming_samples
contents.description: When set to `N`, will stream `N` samples as `current_sample` reading.

description:
Servo is a small motor with arm that can be pointing at a specific direction.

The `min/max_angle/pulse` may be read-only if the servo is permanently affixed to its Jacdac controller.

contents.name: angle
contents.description: Specifies the angle of the arm.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turn the power to the servo on/off.

contents.name: offset
contents.description: Correction applied to the angle to account for the servo arm drift.

contents.name: min_angle
contents.description: Lowest angle that can be set.

contents.name: min_pulse
contents.description: The length of pulse corresponding to lowest angle.

contents.name: max_angle
contents.description: Highest angle that can be set.

contents.name: max_pulse
contents.description: The length of pulse corresponding to highest angle.

contents.name: stall_torque
contents.description: The servo motor will stop rotating when it is trying to move a ``stall_torque`` weight at a radial distance of ``1.0`` cm.

contents.name: response_speed
contents.description: Time to move 60°.

description: Non-volatile key-value storage interface for storing settings.

contents.name: change
contents.description: Notifies that some setting have been modified.

description: A 7-segment numeric display, with one or more digits.

contents.name: brightness
contents.description: Controls the brightness of the LEDs. ``0`` means off.

contents.name: double_dots
contents.description:
Turn on or off the column LEDs (separating minutes from hours, etc.) in of the segment.
If the column LEDs is not supported, the value remains false.

contents.name: digit_count
contents.description: The number of digits available on the display.

contents.name: decimal_point
contents.description: True if decimal points are available (on all digits).

description: A soil moisture sensor.

contents.name: moisture
contents.description: Indicates the wetness of the soil, from ``dry`` to ``wet``.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Describe the type of physical sensor.

description: A push-pull solenoid is a type of relay that pulls a coil when activated.

contents.name: pulled
contents.description: Indicates whether the solenoid is energized and pulled (on) or pushed (off).

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Describes the type of solenoid used.

description: A sound level detector sensor, gives a relative indication of the sound level.

contents.name: sound_level
contents.description: The sound level detected by the microphone

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turn on or off the microphone.

contents.name: min_decibels
contents.description:
The minimum power value considered by the sensor.
If both ``min_decibels`` and ``max_decibels`` are supported,
the volume in deciment can be linearly interpolated between
``[min_decibels, max_decibels]``.

contents.name: max_decibels
contents.description:
The maximum power value considered by the sensor.
If both ``min_decibels`` and ``max_decibels`` are supported,
the volume in deciment can be linearly interpolated between
``[min_decibels, max_decibels]``.

contents.name: loud_threshold
contents.description: The sound level to trigger a loud event.

contents.name: quiet_threshold
contents.description: The sound level to trigger a quite event.

contents.name: loud
contents.description: Raised when a loud sound is detected

contents.name: quiet
contents.description: Raised when a period of quietness is detected

description: A device that can play various sounds stored locally. This service is typically paired with a ``storage`` service for storing sounds.

contents.name: volume
contents.description: Global volume of the output. ``0`` means completely off. This volume is mixed with each play volumes.

description: A microphone that analyzes the sound specturm

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Turns on/off the micropohone.

contents.name: fft_pow2_size
contents.description: The power of 2 used as the size of the FFT to be used to determine the frequency domain.

contents.name: min_decibels
contents.description: The minimum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data

contents.name: max_decibels
contents.description: The maximum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data

contents.name: smoothing_time_constant
contents.description:
The averaging constant with the last analysis frame. 
If ``0`` is set, there is no averaging done, whereas a value of ``1`` means "overlap the previous and current buffer quite a lot while computing the value".

description: A speech synthesizer

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Determines if the speech engine is in a non-paused state.

contents.name: lang
contents.description: Language used for utterances as defined in https://www.ietf.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt.

contents.name: volume
contents.description: Volume for utterances.

contents.name: pitch
contents.description: Pitch for utterances

contents.name: rate
contents.description: Rate for utterances

description: A switch, which keeps its position.

contents.name: active
contents.description: Indicates whether the switch is currently active (on).

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Describes the type of switch used.

contents.name: auto_off_delay
contents.description:
Specifies the delay without activity to automatically turn off after turning on.
For example, some light switches in staircases have such a capability.

contents.name: on
contents.description: Emitted when switch goes from ``off`` to ``on``.

contents.name: off
contents.description: Emitted when switch goes from ``on`` to ``off``.

description: Data transfer over TCP/IP and TLS stream sockets.
A thermocouple using a heat probe to gather temperatures.

contents.name: temperature
contents.description: The temperature.

contents.name: min_temperature
contents.description: Lowest temperature that can be reported.

contents.name: max_temperature
contents.description: Highest temperature that can be reported.

contents.name: temperature_error
contents.description: The real temperature is between `temperature - temperature_error` and `temperature + temperature_error`.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Specifies the type of thermometer.

description: A thermometer measuring outside or inside environment.

contents.name: temperature
contents.description: The temperature.

contents.name: min_temperature
contents.description: Lowest temperature that can be reported.

contents.name: max_temperature
contents.description: Highest temperature that can be reported.

contents.name: temperature_error
contents.description: The real temperature is between `temperature - temperature_error` and `temperature + temperature_error`.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: Specifies the type of thermometer.

description: Controls a mini traffic with a red, orange and green LED.

contents.name: red
contents.description: The on/off state of the red light.

contents.name: orange
contents.description: The on/off state of the red light.

contents.name: green
contents.description: The on/off state of the red light.

description: Measures equivalent Total Volatile Organic Compound levels.

contents.name: TVOC
contents.description: Total volatile organic compound readings in parts per billion.

contents.name: TVOC_error
contents.description: Error on the reading data

contents.name: min_TVOC
contents.description: Minimum measurable value

contents.name: max_TVOC
contents.description: Minimum measurable value

contents.name: conditioning_period
contents.description: Time required to achieve good sensor stability before measuring after long idle period.

description: The UV Index is a measure of the intensity of ultraviolet (UV) rays from the Sun.

contents.name: uv_index
contents.description: Ultraviolet index, typically refreshed every second.

contents.name: uv_index_error
contents.description: Error on the UV measure.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical sensor and capabilities.

description: A vibration motor.

contents.name: enabled
contents.description: Determines if the vibration motor responds to vibrate commands.

description: A sensor that measures liquid/water level.

contents.name: level
contents.description: The reported water level.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical sensor.

description: A weight measuring sensor.

contents.name: weight
contents.description: The reported weight.

contents.name: weight_error
contents.description: The estimate error on the reported reading.

contents.name: zero_offset
contents.description:
Calibrated zero offset error on the scale, i.e. the measured weight when nothing is on the scale.
You do not need to subtract that from the reading, it has already been done.

contents.name: gain
contents.description: Calibrated gain on the weight scale error.

contents.name: max_weight
contents.description: Maximum supported weight on the scale.

contents.name: min_weight
contents.description: Minimum recommend weight on the scale.

contents.name: weight_resolution
contents.description: Smallest, yet distinguishable change in reading.

contents.name: variant
contents.description: The type of physical scale

description: Discovery and connection to WiFi networks. Separate TCP service is used for data transfer.

contents.name: connected
contents.description: Indicates whether or not we currently have an IP address assigned.

contents.name: got_ip
contents.description: Emitted upon successful join and IP address assignment.

contents.name: lost_ip
contents.description: Emitted when disconnected from network.

description: A sensor that measures wind direction.

contents.name: wind_direction
contents.description: The direction of the wind.

contents.name: wind_direction_error
contents.description: Error on the wind direction reading

contents.name: wind_direction_offset
contents.description: Offset added to direction to account for sensor calibration.

description: A sensor that measures wind speed.

contents.name: wind_speed
contents.description: The velocity of the wind.

contents.name: wind_speed_error
contents.description: Error on the reading

contents.name: max_wind_speed
contents.description: Maximum speed that can be measured by the sensor.
